meanings.definition: A large two-handed sword used in medieval times.
meanings.sent1: In the museum, you can see a claymore displayed behind glass.
meanings.sent2: The knight swung the heavy claymore with both hands.
meanings.sent3: The claymore sword looked so big that it could almost be mistaken for a tree branch.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a sharp claymore, cutting through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The shiny claymore gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of ancient power.

meanings.definition: An anti-personnel mine used in warfare.
meanings.sent1: Soldiers carefully placed the claymore mine to protect their camp.
meanings.sent2: The troops detonated the claymore to create a barrier.
meanings.sent3: The claymore mine was so well hidden that even the birds couldn't find it!
meanings.sent4: The impact of his words was like stepping on a hidden claymore, explosive and unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The claymore mine lay dormant, waiting for any unsuspecting intruders to trigger its deadly force.

meanings.sent1: Jamie Claymore was proud of his family name's heritage.
meanings.sent2: The Claymore family reunion was a joyous occasion.
meanings.sent3: When the teacher called out 'Claymore' during attendance, three students raised their hands!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a true Claymore spirit, unyielding and strong.
meanings.sent5: The Claymore clan's tartan was a beautiful display of their Scottish roots.
